intro: Hartogia monticola, commonly known as the mountain hartogia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or white, blooming in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, helping it store water in its native habitat. Hartogia monticola is often found growing in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
